Class GameMenu

java.lang.Object
GameMenu
public class GameMenu
extends java.lang.Object
Handles all menu related things for this game so the main runner looks clean
Author:
James

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.util.Scanner nm
    scanner for user input
    private int turnCount
    keeps track of the number of turns

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    GameMenu()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void battle​(Player pl1, Player pl2, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i1, Item i2)
    Handles the battle basics and declare's a winner depending on the HP of each pokemon.
    void ComputerMenu​(Player pl2, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i2)
    Everything the user can do the computer can do except the computer rely's on RNG choosing a number from 1-3 opposed to input
    void intro​(Player pl1, Player pl2, Pokemon p1)
    Into it gets the user to name themselves their pokemon and their rival
    void PlayerMenu​(Player pl1, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i1)
    Brings up a simple menu where the player can pick their action 1 attack using the abstract attack function in pokemon defined by Eevee 2 item use the item use method implemented in Potion 3 run use the Player run function

  • Method Details

    • intro

      public void intro​(Player pl1, Player pl2, Pokemon p1)
      Into it gets the user to name themselves their pokemon and their rival
      Parameters:
      pl1 - player one the user
      pl2 - player two the computer
      p1 - player one's pokemon

    • battle

      public void battle​(Player pl1, Player pl2, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i1, Item i2)
      Handles the battle basics and declare's a winner depending on the HP of each pokemon. Displays turn count and each pokemon's PP and HP each turn as well.
      Parameters:
      pl1 - Player one
      pl2 - Player two
      p1 - Pokemon one, the Player's
      p2 - Pokemon two, the computer's
      i1 - Player's Item
      i2 - Computer's item

    • PlayerMenu

      public void PlayerMenu​(Player pl1, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i1)
      Brings up a simple menu where the player can pick their action 1 attack using the abstract attack function in pokemon defined by Eevee 2 item use the item use method implemented in Potion 3 run use the Player run function
      Parameters:
      pl1 - player one
      p1 - player one's pokemon
      p2 - player two's pokemon
      i1 - player one's item

    • ComputerMenu

      public void ComputerMenu​(Player pl2, Pokemon p1, Pokemon p2, Item i2)
      Everything the user can do the computer can do except the computer rely's on RNG choosing a number from 1-3 opposed to input
      Parameters:
      pl2 - Player two
      p1 - player one's pokemon
      p2 - player two's pokemon
      i2 - Player two's item
